Write the Lyrics to a Better World-Towards a Sustainable Future

description.narrative: Write the Lyrics to a Better World-Towards a Sustainable Future is a global education project targeted at youth between 13 and 29 years old. The aim of the project is to increase young people?s understanding about the Agenda 2030 and strengthen their belie f in work for sustainable future. The methods used are based on future education and literary art. The project focuses especially on the goals 1: No poverty 5: Gender equality 10: Reduced inequalities 12: Responsible consumption and production and 13: Cli mate action. The project utilizes various communication channels enabling young people?s voices being heard. The project is implemented during 2021?2022. Five groups participate in it in Finland: two junior high school classes Valma- and Telma-groups and youth at risk of marginalization in Kohtaus ry. International cooperation is done with Synapse Network Center in Senegal and Mashup Community Development in South Africa which are Foundation?s long-term development cooperation partners. The African youth produce rap songs about sustainable future that serve as sources of inspiration for Finnish youth. The young people are also in video contact with each other. In Finland the youth groups participate in a workshop process that takes 5-7 weeks. During it th ey address the aforementioned Sustainable Development Goals. As a result of the workshops they will make their own rap-song about the theme which will be performed for the whole school in a closing gala. During the process young activists actor and environ mentalist Jasper Paakkonen as well as rapper and civic influencer Yeboyah encourage young people to dream participate and advocate. Media experts will also organize a media education workshop for them. The activities culminate in a virtual event organized in autumn 2022. In addition the materials that the young people produce will be compiled as exhibitions at the project?s localities. 100 youth 10 teachers and 10 company workers participate in the workshops. 1000 youth and 100 teachers participate in the closing galas. 100 persons participate in the virtual event. The communication of the project reaches about 50 000 people
